questions.q: How many threads does a traditional, heavyweight process have?
questions.explanation: Standard processes perform one task at a time.

questions.q: Provide at least three benefits of multithreaded programming.
questions.explanation: Threads allow a program to keep running even if part of it is blocked.

questions.q: True or False? Concurrency is only possible with parallelism.
questions.explanation: False. Concurrency can exist on a single processor by interleaving execution.

questions.q: True or False? Amdahl's Law addresses the disproportionate effect of the serial portion of a program.
questions.explanation: True. It shows that the speedup is limited by the part of the code that cannot be parallelized.

questions.q: What are the two general types of parallelism?
questions.explanation: Data parallelism distributes data across cores; task parallelism distributes different tasks.

questions.q: List the three common ways of mapping user threads to kernel threads.
questions.explanation: These models determine how the OS manages threads created by the programmer.

questions.q: True or False? Only Linux and Windows implement the one-to-one model.
questions.explanation: False. Many modern operating systems use this model.

questions.q: What are the two approaches for implementing a thread library?
questions.explanation: User-space libraries have no kernel support; kernel-level ones are supported directly by the OS.

questions.q: What are the three main thread libraries in use?
options: POSIX Pthreads, Windows threads, and Java threads
questions.explanation: These are the primary APIs developers use to create multithreaded apps.

questions.q: True or False? PThreads is only a specification, not an implementation.
questions.explanation: True. Pthreads defines the behavior, and individual systems provide the actual code.

questions.q: What is the PThread API for creating a thread?
questions.explanation: This function is used to initialize and start a new Pthread.

questions.q: What is the Windows API for creating a thread?
questions.explanation: This is the primary function for thread creation in the Win32 API.

questions.q: What Java method is used for allocating and initializing a new thread in the JVM?
questions.explanation: Calling start() allocates memory and starts the thread's run() method.

questions.q: Provide at least two techniques for supporting implicit threading.
questions.explanation: Implicit threading lets the compiler or runtime manage threads for the developer.

questions.q: True or False? Grand Central Dispatch only works for Apple's Mac OS X and iOS.
questions.explanation: True. GCD is Apple's specific technology for handling multicore task management.

questions.q: What are the two scenarios for canceling a target thread?
questions.explanation: Asynchronous stops immediately; deferred waits for the thread to reach a safe 'cancellation point'.

questions.q: What term does Linux use to refer to a process or a thread?
questions.explanation: The Linux kernel handles processes and threads similarly, calling both 'tasks'.
